contents.text: This week’s worldwide cover considers the rapid progress being made by artificial intelligence (AI). The technology is arousing a mixture of fear and excitement. The key to regulating it is to balance its promise with an assessment of its risks—and to be ready to adapt.

Leader: How to worry wisely about artificial intelligenceEssay: How AI could change computing, culture and the course of historyScience: Large, creative AI models will transform lives and labour marketsScience: Large language models’ ability to generate text also lets them plan and reasonScience: How generative models could go wrongChina: Can Xi Jinping control AI without crushing it?
